name: Ronnie
text: First time I had Little Caesars. It was very good. I think it's most similar to Domino's. I had the chicken enchilada. It had a lot of cheese, more than the Pizza Hut and Domino's in this area. It was comparable to a out of state Domino's. …More

name: Peter Danshov
text: Very helpful and courteous employees, great efficient service, generous management. Small place with a large heart, although it's a franchise there are no corporate drones here, just warm friendly neighborhood people who love what they do.

name: James Lewis
text: While the prices are great, I'm not a fan of their chicken wings.  On one occasion I had experienced food poisoning. But because I'm not sure if the source derived from them prevents me from blaming them.

name: Shadman Choudhury
text: Best pizza store in this area. It's so cheap yet so tasty. I love their pizza. And the people working there are so friendly and nice. Highly recommended

name: Jeffrey Bliss
text: Cashiers freely admit shutting down store up to 15 minutes before closing. Credit card machine always down so they may as well remove the shoddy handwritten sign demanding cash only. Little Caesar’s in Brooklyn is terrible  compared to stores in the rest of the country.
